article.headline: Virginia Commonwealth 84, Towson 80, 2OT
article.story: TOWSON, Md. (AP) -- B.A. Walker scored six of his 23 points in the second overtime, including the decisive 3-pointer with 34.5 seconds left, and Virginia Commonwealth defeated Towson 84-80 Wednesday night. Walker converted a right-wing 3 to erase an 80-79 Towson lead and give the Rams (10-3, 2-0 Colonial Athletic Association) their eighth win in nine games. Jesse Pellot-Rosa added 19 points and Eric Maynor had 16 points and a career-high 12 assists for VCU, which improved to 11-1 all-time versus the Tigers (6-6, 1-1). Gary Neal led Towson with 36 points, while Dennard Abraham had 16 points and 12 rebounds. Tim Crossin added 12 points and Tommy Breaux had a career-best 11 rebounds. Towson used a 12-2 run -- featuring a steal and slam dunk by Breaux -- midway through the second half to wipe out a 39-30 Rams lead. But VCU, which missed four free throws in the last 2:08 of regulation and put Towson in the bonus with 13:46 left, tied the game at 58 on a pair of Pellot-Rosa foul shots with 3.9 seconds remaining. Abraham's 3 put Towson ahead 67-61 with 2:37 to go in the first overtime, but Maynor converted a baseline bounce pass from Pellot-Rosa with 8.5 seconds left in the extra session, knotting the score at 70 all. Neal, who had seven points in the second overtime, knocked down a 3 with 1:23 left in the game for an 80-77 lead, but Maynor responded with a driving layup to get the Rams within a point. VCU weathered an 0-for-7 start from the field, forced 11 first-half Towson turnovers and held a 25-20 lead at halftime.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
